intro: Pavonia immaculata, commonly known as the white pavonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a rough texture, while its stems are often hairy. Pavonia immaculata thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
